articles.title: Election Committees for Deputies to SPA Start Their Work
articles.content:
Election Committees for Deputies to SPA Start Their Work
 Pyongyang, February 2 (KCNA) -- Election committees were organized in constituencies and sub-constituencies for the election of deputies to the 13th Supreme People's Assembly (SPA) of the DPRK formed in provinces (municipality), cities (district) and counties and in the field of armed forces according to the law of election of deputies to the people's assemblies at all levels of the DPRK and started their work.
					 Preparations are making headway across the country on the threshold of the election of deputies to the 13th SPA.

articles.title: Participants in Meeting of Sub-workteam Heads Present Floral Basket before Statues
articles.content:
Participants in Meeting of Sub-workteam Heads Present Floral Basket before Statues
 Pyongyang, February 2 (KCNA) -- The participants in the national meeting of sub-workteam heads in the field of agriculture paid floral tribute to the statues of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il on Mansu Hill on Sunday.
					 They laid a floral basket and bunches of flowers before the statues, recollecting the revolutionary careers of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il in which they performed great exploits in agricultural development.

articles.title: US. Assailed for Slandering Crucial Proposal of NDC of DPRK
articles.content:
US. Assailed for Slandering Crucial Proposal of NDC of DPRK
 Pyongyang, February 2 (KCNA) -- Papers Sunday in their commentaries disclose the ulterior design sought by the U.S. dignitaries in hurting the crucial proposal made by the National Defence Commission (NDC) of the DPRK.
					 Burns, deputy secretary of Department of State, who visited south Korea after the publication of the proposal, talked aloud about the "possibility of reckless actions to be taken by north Korea in the future and the danger of additional provocation to be made by it".   In the wake of Burns' visit, the assistant secretary of State for East Asian and Pacific Affairs went to south Korea where he talked similar rubbish. The commander-in-chief of the U.S. Armed Forces in the Pacific recklessly asserted Washington is concerned about the nuclear capacity of north Korea, saying nuclear threat coming from north Korea is a source of trouble not only to the U.S. mainland but also in the Korean peninsula and that it may plunge the whole world into confusion.
					
					 Rodong Sinmun terms it Washington's ploy to divert elsewhere the public opinion focused on the proposal made by the DPRK.
					
					 Washington has been busy carrying out its pivot-to-Asia-Pacific strategy.
					
					 After deploying its huge forces in the Asia-Pacific region and various other parts in the world, it has openly revealed its scheme to mount military attacks upon the countries with which it is displeased, being engrossed in posing threats and perpetrating provocations against them.
					
					 It is a calculation of Washington to seize the Korean peninsula, contain the countries around it by using it as a vantage point and thus dominate the Asia-Pacific region.
					
					 The U.S. is, therefore, making so much fuss over the non-existent "threat from the DPRK" in a bid to blunt the world-wide vigilance focused on its move and to carry out its Asia-Pacific strategy. 
					
					 If it is truly interested in peace and security in the Korean peninsula, it should do what it should do before finding fault with the crucial proposal made by the DPRK.
					
					 Minju Joson urged the U.S. to neither meddle in other's affairs nor hinder the efforts for the improvement of inter-Korean relations.

articles.title: S. Koreans Call for Actions against Dictatorship
articles.content:
S. Koreans Call for Actions against Dictatorship
 Pyongyang, February 2 (KCNA) -- Voice of People, south Korean internet paper, posted an article calling for the struggle against dictatorship on Jan. 30.
					 The article said that the situation prevailing in south Korea reminds one of the closing days of the dictatorial regime in 1979.
					
					 The present regime seeking to dissolve the Unified Progressive Party by force is a dictatorial one, the article added. 
					
					 To prevent the revival of dictatorship, all the people desirous of democracy should turn out in the struggle, the article noted.
					
					 No power is above the popular masses, the article said, calling for making preparations for do-or-die actions against the dictatorial regime.

articles.title: Illegal Surveillance of Civilian by IS Slammed
articles.content:
Illegal Surveillance of Civilian by IS Slammed
 Pyongyang, February 2 (KCNA) -- Members of 16 civic and social organizations in Ansan City, Kyonggi Province, held a press conference on Jan. 27 denouncing the Intelligence Service for its illegal surveillance, according to Tongil News, an internet paper of south Korea.
					 At the conference, the speakers disclosed the fact that a member of the service was taken by the collar while shadowing a member of the association of party member in Ansan City of the Unified Progressive Party on Jan. 24.
					
					 The surveillance against civilians is against law, they argued, adding the Intelligence Service is nothing different from the Central Intelligence Agency in the past.
					
					 Then, a press release was read out.
					
					The member of the IS who was caught confessed that his action was an additional investigation into the incident of the plotted rebellion, the press release said, adding:
					
					 If it is true, the incident of the plotted rebellion which the authorities were in charge can not but be a fabrication in which they arrested civilians at random without evidence and issued warrants for them. 
					
					 Shadowing and surveillance against the member of the Ansan City Progressive Party are no more than a plot to evade the crisis caused by the illegal interference in the election.
					
					 As the crackdown upon the party did not meet their intention, IS fabricated a new incident, a childish ploy to wipe out the progressive party at any cost.
					
					 They will not remain a passive onlooker to the illegal surveillance against the people, the press release said, urging IS to stop the surveillance against civilians and political interference and make an apology to the people for their illegal interference in the election.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un's Work Published in Peru
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un's Work Published in Peru
 Pyongyang, February 2 (KCNA) -- Supreme leader Kim Jong Un's work "On Effecting a Drastic Turn in Land Management to Meet the Requirements for Building a Thriving Socialist Nation" was brought out in booklet by a publishing house in Lima City, Peru on January 27.
					 The work, published on April 27, Juche 101 (2012), deals with the immortal feats performed by President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il in land management and indicates the general orientation and tasks for giving a face-lifting to the appearance of the land as befitting a thriving socialist nation.

articles.title: Open Letter of NDC of DPRK Supported by Bangladeshi Political Party
articles.content:
Open Letter of NDC of DPRK Supported by Bangladeshi Political Party
 Pyongyang, February 2 (KCNA) -- The Socialist Party of Bangladesh released a statement on January 27 in support of the open letter of the National Defence Commission (NDC) of the DPRK.
					 The statement said:
					
					 The NDC of the DPRK sent the open letter, which reflects the will to put an end to the national split and improve the north-south relations by the concerted efforts of the two sides, to the authorities, various political parties, social organizations and people of various circles of south Korea.
					
					 The issue of improving the inter-Korean relations serves as a precondition for achieving the reconciliation and unity of the nation.
					
					 In the present period what is important in opening a wide avenue for improving the north-south relations is to stop all hostile military acts, the biggest hurdle lying in the way of removing distrust and confrontation.
					
					 The south Korean authorities should halt drills for a war of aggression they are going to stage with outside forces against the DPRK.
					
					 We fully support the stand of the DPRK to open a wide avenue for improving the north-south relations by the concerted efforts of the Koreans.

articles.title: Crucial Proposal of NDC of DPRK Supported by Organizations of Finland, Ukraine
articles.content:
Crucial Proposal of NDC of DPRK Supported by Organizations of Finland, Ukraine
 Pyongyang, February 2 (KCNA) -- Organizations of Finland and Ukraine expressed support to the crucial proposal of the National Defence Commission (NDC) of the DPRK.
					 The Finland-Korea Society and the Finnish National Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea said in a joint statement on Jan. 26:
					
					 The NDC proposed to halt slandering and military hostile acts against the other side and take a realistic step for preventing nuclear disaster.
					
					 The proposal is of great significance and proves once again the sincere efforts of the DPRK to achieve peace and stability on the Korean peninsula.
					
					 We fully support the crucial proposal of the NDC of the DPRK.
					
					 It is our invariable stand that all hostile acts should be stopped on the Korean peninsula.
					
					 We extend firm solidarity to the Korean people in their struggle to oppose imperialism and prevent a war.
					
					 The Crimean Association for the Study of the Juche Idea of Ukraine stated on Jan. 23:
					
					 We express full support and approval of the peaceful initiatives advanced by the supreme leader of the DPRK to defuse the tensions on the Korean peninsula and in the region and, furthermore, realize the national reunification.
					
					 We condemn foreign forces' act of making the north-south relations destabilized and fanning up the division of the Korean nation.
					
					 We support the DPRK's call on taking practical measures to halt all military hostile acts against the other party.
					
					 We hold that the crucial proposal sent by the NDC of the DPRK to the south Korean authorities is the only right proposal for mending the north-south relations and achieving the peace on the Korean peninsula.

articles.title: Proposal of NDC of DPRK Supported by Regional Body
articles.content:
Proposal of NDC of DPRK Supported by Regional Body
 Pyongyang, February 2 (KCNA) -- The International Alliance of Societies for the Study of the Juche Idea and Songun Policy in East European and Central Asian Regions issued a statement on January 25 in support of the crucial proposal and an open letter made by the National Defence Commission (NDC) of the DPRK.
					 The statement said:
					
					 As the NDC of the DPRK said in the open letter, the history of the territorial division brought unspeakable disaster and sufferings to the Korean nation. The foreign forces are to blame for this.
					
					 Supreme leader of the DPRK Kim Jong Un in his New Year Address set forth the reasonable and principled issues arising in accelerating the national reunification in order to put an end to the history of the territorial and national division.
					
					 The NDC of the DPRK sent a crucial proposal on January 16 and the open letter on Jan. 23 to the south Korean authorities as part of its efforts to open a wide avenue for improving the north-south relations.
					
					 The DPRK also took a unilateral measure of halting the acts of slandering south Korea.
					
					 We see that it is very important to take a decision to stop all the military hostile acts on the Korean Peninsula.
					
					 We contend that the independent reunification of Korea and peace and prosperity of the Korean Peninsula can be achieved only when the north-south relations are improved.
					
					 If the crisis prevailing on the Korean Peninsula is not settled, it will reach an uncontrolled phase and cause dangerous international confrontation.

articles.title: Day of Shining Star to Be Marked in Peru
articles.content:
Day of Shining Star to Be Marked in Peru
 Pyongyang, February 2 (KCNA) -- A Peruvian preparatory committee for celebrating the 72nd birth anniversary of Generalissimo Kim Jong Il (Day of the Shining Star) was inaugurated in Lima on January 26.
					 Tani Baler Lopera, international secretary of the Communist Party of Peru "Red Motherland" who doubles as chairman of the Peruvian Committee for Supporting the Independent and Peaceful Reunification of Korea, was elected chairman of the preparatory committee.
					
					 The preparatory committee decided to organize diverse political and cultural events for praising the revolutionary career and exploits of leader Kim Jong Il on the Day of the Shining Star.

articles.title: Day of Shining Star to Be Marked in Pakistan
articles.content:
Day of Shining Star to Be Marked in Pakistan
 Pyongyang, February 2 (KCNA) -- A Pakistani national preparatory committee for celebrating the birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il (Day of the Shining Star) was inaugurated in Karachi on January 24.
					 A senator affiliated with the Pakistan Awami National Party was elected chairman of the preparatory committee.
					
					 The preparatory committee decided to widely introduce the revolutionary career and exploits of leader Kim Jong Il and organize diverse political and cultural events on the Day of the Shining Star.

articles.title: Organizados comites en distritos y subdistritos electorales
articles.content:
Organizados comites en distritos y subdistritos electorales
Pyongyang, 2 de febrero (ACNC) -- Quedaron organizados los comites electorales en los distritos y subdistritos para las elecciones de diputados a la XIII Legislatura de la Asamblea Popular Suprema que comenzaron a trabajar ya. 
					Los distritos y subdistritos fueron fundados anteriormente en las provincias (o las ciudades directamente subordinadas al centro), las ciudades (o los municipios), los distritos y en las instituciones de fuerzas armadas, en virtud de la ley de elecciones de diputados a las asambleas populares a todos los niveles de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea. 
					
					En visperas de esos comicios, marchan bien los preparativos en todas las localidades del pais en medio del elevado fervor politico de todos los ciudadanos.
